Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ad-hep (hepcidin, Cys-rich; 4S=S, UCSS1a; natural AMPs; shrimp, Crustaceans, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; BBMm)

Literature.Author: Anooja VV, Archana K, Athira PP, Anju MV, Neelima S, Muhammed Musthafa S, Dhaneesha M, Sajeevan TP, Singh ISB, Philip R. 2024
Literature.Title: Antibacterial activity and modes of action of a novel hepcidin isoform from the shrimp scad, Alepes djedaba (ForsskÃ¥l, 1775).

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (84.62%) tofish 	SA-hepcidin1C: 29%. GRAVY: -0.0708; mol Wt: 2707.305; mol formula: C110H173N33O30S8; mol ex coeff: 1927.5.Chemical modification:  4 disulfide bonds: C1-C8, C2-C7, C3-C6, and C4-C5.Activity: active against  V-harveyi (MIC >32 uM),  V-cholera (MIC >32 uM),  V-alginolyticus (MIC >32 uM),  V. parahaemolyticus (MIC 32 uM),  V-fluvialis (MIC >32 uM),  V-proteolyticus (MIC >32 uM), A-hydrophila (MIC > 32 uM),  P-aeruginosa (MIC > 32 uM), E-coli (MIC > 32 uM), E. tarda (MIC 32 uM), S-aureu (MIC > 32 uM), and B-cereus (MIC > 32 uM). It showed inhibitory effect on most of these bacteria.MOA:bacteria: act on bacterial membranes.Est.Jan2024;
